page.title: 05PARKWOOD SCHOOL - SCIENCE
page.content: Our local newspaper is the Keighley News. Sometimes our school is mentioned in it as in July 1982 when there was a report and a photograph about our scientific investigations. We collect mini-beasts from the woods, wasteland and playgrounds aroung the school. In 1982 we exhibited our work at the Bradford Science Fair. Under stones we found{ants, beetles, snails, {spiders, woodlice, millipedes, slugs {and earwigs. }We kept them in a glass observation tank set up with soil, plants and stones to simulate their environment. We have also, as a school, been studying a land profile, looking at creatures which live on or below the ground, in streams or ponds around us, and at wild flowers such as {dandelions, vetch, coltsfoot, willow {herb, stitchwort,}which thrive at present in our area.
